ideas.title: Listen Labs raises $69M after viral billboard hiring stunt to scale AI customer interviews
ideas.description: Alfred Wahlforss was running out of options. His startup, Listen Labs, needed to hire over 100 engineers, but competing against Mark Zuckerberg's $100 million offers seemed impossible. So he spent $5,000 — a fifth of his marketing budget — on a billboard in San Francisco displaying what looked like gibberish: five strings of random numbers.The numbers were actually AI tokens. Decoded, they led to a coding challenge: build an algorithm to act as a digital bouncer at Berghain, the Berlin nigh
hooks: How a $5k Billboard Hack Landed $69M in Funding
Viral Recruiting Stunt: AI's Wildest Hiring Trick
Cracking the Code: Startup's Genius Talent Grab

tips: Use live chat to engage audience during decoding segments
